;;This month, the biggest event in the animation industry;, the non-animated version of "Attack on The ending of "Giant" is none other than this. The long-awaited final work finally brings an end to this epic series.

;

;;;

;;"Attack on Titan" is the representative work of Japanese comic artist Isayama Hajime. It has a total of 139 chapters and was serialized in comic magazines for twelve years from 2009 to 2021. In 2013, the TV animation version of "Attack on Titan" came out. After ten years of production, a total of four seasons were released (except for the theatrical version and special episodes).

;

;According to the Douban entry, the complete viewing order of the entire drama is: "Attack on Titan" (2013) → "Attack on Titan" Season 2 (2017) → "Attack on Titan" "Attack on Titan" Season 3 (2018) → "Attack on Titan" Season 3 Part.2 (2019) → "Attack on Titan" Final Season Part.1 (2020) Part.2 (2022) → "Attack on Titan" The final season the final part the first part the second part (2023). ;

;

;;

;

;;The unique world view structure, bizarre background setting, incredible imagination, bloody battle scenes, and sensitive issues made this work popular as soon as it came out. attracted the attention of all walks of life. But while attracting countless viewers, it was also banned by many countries in the world due to its large scale.

;

;Despite this, it still achieved a good rating on Douban, with Jiji scoring 9 points+, and even the least optimistic final chapter has a rating of 9.3.

;

;;;

;;Since the comic version has been completed in 2021, the audience already knows the ending of this work. It is worth noting that when the comic was completed, it caused huge controversy due to the plot that violated human ethics and was criticized by fans as a "bad ending".

;

;The fundamental reason is that Allen, the protagonist of "Attack on Titan", is suspected of "matricide". With his precognitive ability, he most likely manipulated the Immaculate Titan to eat his mother, leaving a huge psychological trauma on his young self. He then joined the Survey Corps, determined to get rid of the Titan. This setting is mainly to make the whole story logical and ; form a closed loop of cause and effect. ;

;

;;But whether it is based on the emotions of the characters or the emotions of the audience, this setting is difficult to accept, and there is a sense of powerlessness in trying to justify it. To paraphrase netizens, this move is tantamount to “Harry Potter manipulating Voldemort to go back in time and kill his parents”, “Batman buying a thief to go back in time and kill his parents”, “Iron Man instructing the Winter Soldier to go back and kill him” One’s own parents”. ;

;

;;In the animated version, this "matricide" plot was brushed aside and explained in an extremely vague manner. Because of this, it wasn't as controversial as the comic version, but it just added a bit of tragedy to Allen. ;

;

;;

;

;;The reason why "Attack on Titan" is hailed as; a masterpiece is that it reflects reality and depicts an imaginary world with great conflict.

;

;The story begins with an invasion of giants on Parady Island. Human beings were unable to resist the giants, so they built three high walls (Xina, Rose, and Maria) to resist the giants, in exchange for a hundred years of peace. But the terrifying giant still came. "On that day, mankind finally recalled the fear of being dominated by giants, and the humiliation of being trapped in a birdcage;.";

;

;;Eren and his friends Mikasa and Armin suffered heavy blows during the Titan invasion, and were eventually admitted to the Survey Corps to fight against the Titans together. At first, the growth path of Allen and others followed the routine of traditional hot-blooded comics. But as the plot continues to advance, the audience soon discovers its anomaly - it does not stick to the binary opposition of good and evil, but digs deeper into the complexity of human nature. ;

;

;;The reversal in the plot drives the audience and the protagonist to constantly think together and break, rebuild, and break their own thinking. Allen's life was hanging by a thread during the battle, but he unexpectedly forced out his giant power. There are also many giants hidden in the Survey Corps. The three comrades who have been with Allen through life and death not only have the power of giants, but they are also "spies." I originally thought that giants were inhuman monsters, but I didn't expect that giants are also human beings. Giants have also suffered from wars and are victims of racial antagonism. ;

;

;;

;

;;All humans who can become giants; are Eldians. They are regarded by ordinary people as "descendants of demons." Two thousand years ago, the Eldians, who received the power of giants from their ancestor Ymir, became kings of the world. A hundred years ago, the Eldians were defeated by the Marais. The royal family led some people across the ocean to Parady Island and lived an isolated life.

;

;And those Eldians who stayed in other countries were reduced to slaves and lived like a concentration camp. For thousands of years, ordinary people have been deeply hostile to the Eldians and have always wanted to get rid of them. This kind of hostility led Allen to "blackening", and he decided to use the sound of the earth to launch the "Destruction Plan" - hundreds of thousands of 60-meter-tall super-large ; Innocent Titans ran rampant on the earth, indiscriminately Trampling all life, massacred 80% of the human population outside Parady Island. ;

;

;;The final chapter tells about the "final battle" after the earthquake started. At the end, Mikasa found Eren's true body under the cover of other members, then cut off Eren's head and gave him a passionate kiss. ;

;

;;

;

;;On the surface, "Attack on Titan"; tells the story of "a boy who slays dragons and eventually turns into a dragon." However, upon closer inspection, it is not that Simplicity is about sacrifice, but also about salvation.

;

;Ellen's death has long been doomed. As early as the investiture ceremony, he had already predicted the future. He repeatedly tried to change his destiny, but all ended in failure. In order to break the reincarnation, let the giant's power disappear completely, and let the Eldians be treated as equals and even respected, he can only embark on an extremely lonely road. He started the roar of the earth, started the massacre, and then made his companions heroes, intending to use his own sacrifice to exchange for the peace of the Eldians. ; As he himself said, "This is to save Parady Island." The only way to win over everyone”. ;

;

;;What Allen did was another way of ending sorrow with war. He weighed the difference between salvation and sacrifice, and finally chose to sacrifice the whole world to save those around him. This decision transformed him from a hero into a demon. ;

;

;;

;

;;In addition to exploring the complexity of human nature, ; "Attack on Titan" also involves many profound propositions.

;

;For example, freedom. Allen has always pursued freedom. Since he was a child, he has been curious about the sea outside the wall and the other side of the sea, thinking that it is an ideal world of freedom. But in the end, he discovered that "there are enemies on the other side of the sea." So-called freedom, especially absolute freedom, does not exist at all. As a result, Allen finally became a free slave until death freed him.

;

;Another example is the discussion on the meaning of survival. In the final chapter, Armin and Zeke have a philosophical conversation. Jike is a typical pessimist. He believes that the fate of human beings is to undergo an endless and painful reincarnation. The purpose of life is to reproduce, which is meaningless. Armin believes that the meaning of life lies in the moment and the feeling of living in the present: picking up shells at the beach, running with friends, reading at home on a rainy day, watching squirrels eating tree fruits... these may seem random. The sporadic fragments constitute a colorful chapter in human life. ;

;

;;These propositions give "Attack on Titan" a depth that ordinary hot-blooded comics do not have. Therefore, in a sense, in the past ten years, the audience has watched Allen and others grow and part ways, and at the same time, as their personal minds have matured, they have gained more perception and understanding of this work. ;

;

;;The divisions and wars in the human world caused by issues such as wealth and poverty, race, ideology, etc., are always recurring and endless. Just like the current Israeli-Palestinian conflict, they always seem to verify the metaphors contained in Isayama Hajime's "Attack on Titan" again and again. ;

;

;;At the end of the story, Mikasa buried Eren under the tree where he liked to take a nap. In the future, even if the power of giants is lost, human wars will never stop. At this time, a man discovered the tree where Allen was buried. He walked in, and just like the ancestor Ymir thousands of years ago, he was about to gain the power of a giant...;

;

;;This seems to tell us that as long as the fate of mankind changes over and over again, , then the tragedy will not be completely ended. ;

;

;;

;

;;In this case, is this world with constant conflicts still worth our efforts, struggle and life? ;

;

;;This goes back to the conversation between Zeke and Armin. They are like the two sides of Sou Isayama. On the one hand, they reveal the nature of the world and point out its cruelty to us; on the other hand, they give us warmth, hope and strength, allowing us to base ourselves on the present, cherish precious moments, and live our lives well. ;

;

;;Perhaps, in the final analysis, everything is just a matter of choice. Will you choose to be Zeke or Armin? Or do you have other options? No matter how you want to survive in the world, it all depends on you. ;

;August 19, 2023, Beijing, WeWork joint shared office space;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;On the morning of October 12th, Huang Wei, who was on his way to work, suddenly received a mass notice from the front desk - the office area will be closed from now on. Stop water supply. Soon after arriving at the company, he was told that the WeWork co-working space in Shanghai World Trade Center could no longer continue to operate, and tenants needed to move to other WeWork properties as soon as possible.

;

;Huang Wei’s start-up team has just settled in September 2023. The rent was lower than he expected, with the monthly quote for a single workstation being 1,200 yuan. When he first returned to China at the end of 2019, he learned about the market situation. The price of a WeWork near the Suzhou River for the same configuration of workstations was around 2,000 yuan. The salesman told him that if the high vacancy rate hadn't affected his business, he wouldn't have been able to sign for this location at this price. At that time, in this WeWork, the office areas with less than 5 people were quite saturated, while the offices with more than 10 people were completely vacant.

;

;The "first come, first served" reminder at the front desk did not allow him to hesitate. Huang Wei quickly selected an office space located one kilometer away by WeWork. When he saw the news that "WeWork filed for bankruptcy protection", he had already moved into the WeWork office area in Shanghai Plaza for half a month.

;

;On November 6, local time, in order to get rid of huge debts, WeWork filed for bankruptcy protection in New Jersey, USA. However, the bankruptcy filing is limited to WeWork's offices in the United States and Canada. The next day, WeWork China issued a statement stating that WeWork China had separated from WeWork at the end of 2020 and had independent operating and management capabilities as an independent brand. "The major strategic restructuring decisions made by WeWork in the United States and Canada have no connection with WeWork China." ." 

;

;WeWork, founded in New York, USA, is known as the "originator of shared office." WeWork will lease commercial buildings for a long time at preferential prices, then divide them into shared office spaces after redesigning and renovating them. WeWork will provide flexible leasing contracts for freelancers, start-ups and large enterprises, etc., and earn rent differences and additional service fees.

;

;In 2010, when it was first founded, the negative impact of the U.S. financial crisis was still continuing. Commercial buildings were widely idle due to the wave of business closures, a large number of companies laid off employees, and the unemployed became freelancers. WeWork, which emerged at that time, not only provided stylish decoration and flexible leasing options, but also provided free coffee drinks and organized a variety of community activities... WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann advocated "space as a service" and declared To create a "physical social network", a "world that allows people to live rather than just make a living."

;

;;

;

;On November 6, 2019, in Tokyo, Japan, SoftBank Group Chairman and President Masayoshi Son attended a press conference. SoftBank said the value of its investment in WeWork fell by nearly $4.6 billion ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;U.S. benchmark after financial crisis Interest rates have been at a low level for a long time, and capital is eager to enter the private equity market to seek higher returns. In an era when the concept of the sharing economy was highly popular, WeWork became the darling of capital and became a unicorn only four years after its establishment. In 2019, with the support of major shareholder SoftBank, WeWork's valuation soared to an astonishing US$47 billion.

;

;At that time, SoftBank Group CEO Masayoshi Son called WeWork "the next Alibaba." Alibaba is the most successful investment case of this "unicorn hunter". In 2000, SoftBank invested US$20 million in Alibaba, which was only one year old. 14 years later, Alibaba went public, and the value of SoftBank’s shares increased approximately 2,900 times.

;

;SoftBank was once the investment benchmark in the sharing economy track. Masayoshi Son advocates injecting massive amounts of capital into start-up companies to help them quickly crush competitors in scale and become a dominant brand in the market, hoping to achieve long-term profitability after gaining absolute advantages in users and the market. Uber and Didi are SoftBank’s investment cases in the sharing economy track during the same period.

;

;However, half a year after WeWork reached the peak of its valuation, it fell into a long and steep decline stage. In August 2019, as the initial public offering (IPO) application was exposed, WeWork's consecutive losses triggered market concerns about the company's profitability. Neumann's financial and leadership issues have also been exposed one after another. In the same month, Uber, which had just been listed for half a year, suffered its largest loss since announcing its financial report after falling below the issue price. For a time, there was a lot of discussion about the bursting of the unicorn bubble. WeWork’s plans to go public have been put on hold indefinitely.

;

;Since then, Neumann resigned as CEO and new management was brought in to help restructure the company's leasing business. It wasn't until October 2021 that WeWork finally went public with a valuation of US$9 billion. However, going public is not a panacea. Instead, it has become a magnifying glass that continues to expose problems. Although WeWork has always regarded itself as a technology company, it has never been able to achieve non-linear growth relying on its own profits, and its business model has not departed from the category of asset-heavy commercial real estate leasing. WeWork's customers are mainly small and entrepreneurial institutions with weak risk resistance and high liquidity. As competition in the industry becomes increasingly fierce, WeWork has to face the problem of price reductions and rising costs in order to retain these customers who are extremely cost-sensitive.

;

;The COVID-19 epidemic broke out around the world in 2020, and working from home became a common trend. The economic recession caused a large number of customers to close their businesses, and the office vacancy rate increased sharply. As a "second landlord", WeWork still needs to pay rent to the landlord. WeWork, which emerged from the previous crisis, became a victim of the new crisis. Maturity mismatch may bring huge profits during economic booms, but it is a heavy burden during economic downturns, and the Federal Reserve's several rounds of interest rate hikes since the epidemic have exacerbated WeWork's debt burden. The long-standing systemic risks have ushered in a concentrated outbreak.

;

;;

;

;On April 12, 2018, WeWork co-founder Neumann visited Shanghai;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;In August 2023, WeWork pointed out in its second-quarter financial report that taking into account losses and expected cash needs, coupled with increased membership losses and current liquidity levels, the company's continued operations depend on management. Whether the company can improve its liquidity and profitability over the next 12 months. As of June 30, the company still had $2.9 billion in long-term debt and $13.3 billion in long-term lease debt.

;

;WeWork CEO David Tolley believes that "unsustainable leases must be repriced" due to a lack of "the necessary financial flexibility to adapt to the rapidly changing commercial real estate market." Filing for bankruptcy protection is WeWork's attempt to survive in adversity. WeWork is seeking court approval to terminate 69 leases that are "substantially unable to operate" and negotiate with more than 400 landlords to modify existing leases. Analysts generally believe that WeWork’s exit will lead to a further increase in the already high office vacancy rate, which will have a negative impact on the cash flow and value of office buildings.

;

;Like a cycle. While the market is enthusiastically discussing the butterfly effect caused by the WeWork crisis, competitors are more willing to regard WeWork's "big defeat" as an "episode" in industry changes, or even as an opportunity.

;

;“The great irony of WeWork’s bankruptcy is that it happened at a time of record performance for the industry.” Jamie Hodari, CEO of Industrious, a New York-based shared office operator, told the Financial Times "I made a metaphor during the interview, "When a Marriott hotel is not doing well, it will become a Hyatt hotel." Mark Dixon, CEO of IWG Group, who is also a shared office operator, said in an interview with the BBC, IWG has now acquired and relaunched 40 office spaces that were once part of WeWork.

;

;Based on the lessons learned from WeWork, the shift from the asset-heavy model of "direct leasing" to the light-asset model of "profit sharing" has been a common effort in the industry in recent years, and now it is even more urgent. However, whether owners are willing to accept this adjustment still depends on their comprehensive assessment of the economic environment and operational value. A recent report released by IWG shows that 200 of the 204 new office spaces it signed in the third quarter of 2023 are asset-light operations, but overall, 60% are still operated by traditional leasing methods. .

;

;In the Chinese market, WeWork China also hopes to become the traffic entrance in the stock era. "The business model that only relies on rent difference is very difficult, but this is also our core competitiveness and advantage," Quan Bin, vice president of WeWork Greater China, said in a recent interview with "Guandian New Media" that companies must survive To achieve better and longer results, we must work faster and more resolutely in reducing costs and increasing efficiency.

;

;;

;

;Shanghai, WeWork joint shared office space;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;For Huang Weilai He said that while the decrease in rent costs is a good thing, it also reflects the downturn in the real estate industry. Huang Wei's entrepreneurial project involves architectural design, and the quality of his business is closely related to the ups and downs of the industry.

;

;At the end of 2019, Huang Wei returned to China from the Netherlands and worked successively in a European and American architectural design company and a local design studio. "Party A is not doing well, and it is even more difficult for those who provide design services downstream. The number of projects that can be received has shrunk severely, and the industry is seriously involved. If you want to survive, you must either sink or shrink. Even if you can get orders, The price/performance ratio is also very low. Many of my classmates and friends have changed careers." In early 2022, Huang Wei and two other partners co-founded Miaoqi Design Studio. Faced with uncertainty and the threshold of 30 years old, Huang Wei still persistently wants to try again in the industry he loves.

;

;After starting a business for more than a year, he has been sharing his entrepreneurial experience on social media. This small office relocation incident was also edited into a short video by him. At the end of the video, he talked about his views on this "uncertain era." Unexpectedly, this became one of his most watched videos recently. Private messages poured in like snowflakes. Many comments expressed their empathy for such sudden changes. Of course, there are more "advertisers" selling his office space to him. According to CBRE's forecast, the new supply of Shanghai's office market in the second half of 2023 is expected to exceed 950,000 square meters, the highest level in the past decade. Demand is weak, supply is increasing, and the office market is still in a slow recovery period.

;

;Huang Wei quickly crossed the message board. The sudden closure of offices pales in comparison to the pressure to continue operations. His lease is signed until September 2024. 2023 is about to pass, and the intensity of competition in the industry is far more intense than last year. At the bidding meeting, master-level firms competed for it, and it has become very common to choose one of two to three hundred proposals. How about next year? He still "has hope."

;

;In May this year, many viewers reported that they bought "pillar tickets" at Leung Jingru's Shanghai concert, and the view was It was obscured by the pillars surrounding the stage, causing heated discussions. On November 17, Ms. Li, who bought the "pillar ticket", told Nandu reporters that a total of nine audience members filed lawsuits against the concert organizer, Shanghai Rubik's Cube Pan-Cultural Performing Arts Co., Ltd. On November 15, the first instance of the Meilong People's Court of the Minhang District People's Court of Shanghai opened in public to hear the case.

;

;;;

;;On-site picture of the "pillar ticket" provided by Ms. Li. ;

;

;;9 viewers sued the concert organizer;

;

;On May 20th and 21st this year, the 2023 Leung Jingru World Tour Concert was held in Shanghai held, many audience members reported that after arriving, they found that their view was blocked by the pillars around the stage, and "looking at the singers became like looking at the pillars." Some netizens posted on social platforms saying, "I spent 1,599 to win the pillar position at Liang Jingru's concert" and "I spent 1,599 to buy something bad" and so on.

;

;On November 17, Ms. Li, a concert attendee, told Nandu reporters that nine audience members, including herself, filed lawsuits against the concert organizer, Shanghai Rubik's Pan-Cultural Performing Arts Co., Ltd., demanding reasonable refunds. payment and compensation.

;

;On the afternoon of November 15, the first instance of the Meilong People’s Court of the Minhang District People’s Court of Shanghai opened in public to hear the case. Ms. Li said, "The result of the court trial has not yet been announced. We are waiting for the organizer's mediation plan. If we still cannot accept the plan they propose, we will wait for the court's decision."

;

;Ms. Li introduced that this Among the 9 spectators who filed the lawsuit this time, 6 were spectators of the May 20th matinee and 3 were spectators of the May 21st matinee. The ticket prices included 1,299 yuan, 999 yuan, etc. "We submitted materials to the court in early August to apply for filing a case, and received news of the court filing the case at the end of August. We all met through social media, and because the early negotiations with the organizer failed, we had no choice but to choose to sue. We wanted to We need to find out whether the organizer has violated our legitimate rights and interests."

;

;Ms. Li said that she purchased two tickets for the second-floor stand worth 1,299 yuan on May 20, and the attendance rate that day was quite high. The photo shows that in the middle of Ms. Li's field of vision is a hollow pillar, and the singer can be vaguely seen.

;

;A Nandu reporter searched for the seat distribution map and found that the two diagonal lines formed by the four corners were basically blocked by pillars, but this was not marked on the page.

;

;It is understood that the organizer, Shanghai Rubik's Cube Pan-Cultural Performing Arts Co., Ltd., has responded that it is only responsible for the implementation of Liang Jingru's Shanghai concert, and the stage will not be built by the company. During the ticket sales stage, the company did not know that the stage design would have four pillars.

;

;Ms. Li told Nandu reporters that the organizer had said that within the coverage area approved by it, a 200 yuan shopping card would be given as a token of appreciation. "No matter what the price of the ticket, only 200 yuan will be compensated." .

;

;;The focus of the dispute is whether the organizer should inform in advance;

;

;On November 15, during the court hearing of the case, the two sides focused on "whether the organizer should notify Court investigations and debates were conducted on controversial issues such as informing in advance the existence of 'pillar tickets' and whether these locations would affect the concert experience."

;

;Ms. Li introduced to Nandu reporters that the nine plaintiffs' requests mainly include three aspects - requesting an order to order the defendant to return the plaintiff's concert ticket money; ordering the defendant to pay punitive damages to the plaintiff; ordering the defendant to pay punitive damages to the plaintiff; Bear the litigation costs of this case.

;

;The plaintiff’s attorney said that the focus of this case is whether the defendant informed all the plaintiffs in advance whether their views would be blocked. The plaintiff’s purpose for attending the concert was to “see” it, and having his view blocked was a very serious breach of contract. The plaintiff's right to know was violated, resulting in the loss of the right to choose.

;

;The defendant’s attorney said that the reason why the performance used load-bearing columns was because the venue’s ceiling was not load-bearing enough. Without the load-bearing columns on the ground, the performance would not have been able to be held normally and would not have passed the safety approval. So the ground load-bearing columns were used. Columns are also common practice in the industry. "It is common sense that certain positions in the auditorium will inevitably block the view. The defendant has never deliberately mentioned in the publicity that there are no pillars or obstructions."

;

;The plaintiff believes that the design and layout of the scene It should have been completed earlier. Before the concert begins, the organizer should also fulfill its corresponding responsibilities, inform consumers whose vision will be blocked, and ask them whether they want a refund or other solutions.

;

;The defendant’s attorney stated that the defendant set up the stage mainly for safety reasons and did not intentionally deceive the audience. Moreover, this performance is the first stop of a series of tours, and they cannot be harshly criticized for considering so many things in advance. details. The response methods for other subsequent performances were improved after being affected by this performance. The first stop cannot be required based on the handling plan for subsequent performances; nor can it be considered that the defendant did not inform the defendant in advance just because the line of sight was blocked at some individual performances. There is an intention to deceive.

;

;At about 3 pm on the 15th, the trial of this case ended, but the verdict was not pronounced in court.

;

;;The China Consumers Association has criticized the phenomenon of "pillar tickets" by name;

;

;Concert organizers have dealt with "pillar tickets" differently.

;

; Nandu previously reported that on August 14 this year, Shanxi Xingtai Lighting Culture and Entertainment Co., Ltd., the organizer of Jay Chou's 2023 Carnival World Tour Concert in Hohhot, issued an announcement saying that it would meet the needs of fans and allow more Fans can experience the joyful atmosphere of the concert live and reduce congestion outside the concert. After coordinating and fighting with all parties, the organizer will sell the seats with poor visibility in the area blocked by the sound console at a special discount.

;

;At the same time, the organizer stated in the announcement that the viewing angle of the seats in this area is affected by the sound console and is blocked to varying degrees. It is impossible to fully see the entire stage. A large screen is set up behind the sound console for the convenience of the audience. Watch, special discounted tickets are non-refundable and non-exchangeable after purchase.

;

;On August 2, the China Consumers Association criticized the phenomenon of various "pillar tickets" and "wall tickets", pointing out that consumers encountered "blind selection" of seats when purchasing performance tickets online, and some performance venues did not support consumption. The visitor chose his seat when purchasing the ticket, but when he arrived at the venue, he learned that what he had purchased was a "pillar ticket" or a "wall ticket" with blind spots, which caused a ticketing problem of "only sounds but no people" throughout the concert.

;

;The China Consumers Association said that relevant performance ticketing platforms and organizers should consider how to better protect the rights and interests of consumers and improve the consumer experience from the perspective of promoting the release of consumption potential.

;;Doctoral profile:;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng, the first Ph.D. in constitutional law in New China. ;

;

;;Born in 1942 in Pinggu County, Beijing (now Pinggu District);;

;

;;In 1966, graduated from the Law Department of Beijing Institute of Political Science and Law (now China University of Political Science and Law); worked in Guangxi after graduation Served in judicial, education, and administrative work; in 1978, he was admitted to the Law Department of the Graduate School of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences for further study. After graduating with a master's degree, Worked at the Institute of Law of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences; in 1983, he studied for a doctorate in constitutional law under the tutelage of the jurist Zhang Youyu; , STKaiti;">;Received a doctorate in law in 1987;;

;

;;Served as a professor of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences Deputy director, professor and doctoral supervisor of the Constitutional Administrative Law Research Office of the Institute of Law, part-time professor and doctoral supervisor at 7 universities including Shanghai Jiao Tong University Law School and Beijing Normal University Law School, and honorary expert advisory member of the Expert Advisory Committee of the Supreme People's Procuratorate. Enjoy special allowances from the State Council. ;

;

;;

;

;In October 2023, Chen Yunsheng In a study in the suburbs of Beijing. (Southern Weekend reporter Chen Yifan/Photo)

;

;81-year-old Chen Yunsheng seldom rests.

;

;His days start at four or five in the morning, walking briskly, cooking, reading and writing in Pinggu District on the outskirts of Beijing, leading a regular old age life. He planted beans, sweet potatoes, pumpkins and corn on a piece of wasteland he "claimed", and irrigated and cultivated it from time to time.

;

;The interest in farming stems from his background.

;

;This rural boy, born in Pinggu in 1942, is the first high school student, the first college student, and the first doctor of law in the village. In 1966, after graduating from Beijing University of Political Science and Law (now China University of Political Science and Law), he was assigned to rural areas in Guangxi, where he ate and lived with farmers, waking up to the steaming heat of beef and feces every day.

;

;After the country resumed the postgraduate examination, he relied on a "survived" constitutional law tutorial and was admitted to the law school of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences with the first score in the reexamination. graduate School. Later, he studied for a doctorate and became the only student of the famous legal scholar Zhang Youyu.

;

;During this period, he read all the professional books in the law school and went from a "minion" in constitutional law to "the first person in the country to supervise the constitution." In 1980, he participated in the formulation of the "82nd Constitution" amendment. He always believed that the true meaning of the Constitution did not lie in the constitutional document itself.

;

;On his academic journey, he did not like to participate in administrative affairs and turned away many opportunities. He laughs at himself as "a lonely ghost in academia", who only seeks to achieve the ultimate in knowledge and will never be swayed by trends.

;

;He advised students to endure loneliness. He always followed the third item of Descartes' code of conduct: he always only sought to overcome himself, not to overcome fate, but only to change his own desires, not to change the order of the world.

;

;"God helps me"

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After retirement, what is your daily life like now? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;I usually get up at four in the morning, have something to eat, and then go to the river. exercise. I used to run or walk. After I got seriously ill in May or June this year and was exhausted, I cycled for an hour to exercise. Then come back to research or write for an hour, then make breakfast and clean up. After breakfast, I go to work in the fields, usually for two hours, and then come back to continue my research. Two days ago, I was still harvesting vegetables grown in the fields. After lunch break, I worked at my desk again. Then I went to the fields to do some work, and then rode a bike for exercise in the evening. There are no weekends or holidays, and I don’t know what day of the week it is every day. It has been the same day for decades. For me, going out to give lectures and attend societies is also a rare way to rest. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; There are not many old people like you who are still farming in their eighties. Why do you live such a life as a farmer? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;My family has been poor farmers for generations. There are five brothers in the family, and I am the second oldest. When I was a child, Confucius said, "I am a young man, so I can do many despicable things." In addition to going to school, I had to help the family with work, planting fields, harvesting wild vegetables, chopping firewood, feeding pigs and cows, and I did all the work that rural children do. Pass. ;

;

;When I was about to enter middle school, a junior high school was established in a neighboring village. Children from the eastern, southern and northern areas of Pinggu could go to school. As a result, after we registered, Found that there was only an open space. The first thing we do when we go to school is dig the foundation and build the house. It took more than half a year to have a classroom and a canteen, and a simple basketball court was built. The students borrowed villagers' houses as dormitories and kitchens.

;

;At that time, the school funds were not enough, and there happened to be a shoe factory that made cloth shoes, so we contracted part of the factory's projects. My shoemaking skills were relatively good, so I was made a supervisor.

;

;During the high school entrance examination, the whole county accepted more than a hundred high school students. I was the first in the village to pass the high school entrance examination.

;

;In the college entrance examination, only three subjects: mathematics, Chinese and chemistry. In the summer, I lay on the field or on the hillside and looked at the clear sky. Meteors came one after another, and the Milky Way was clearly visible. So when I applied for my college application, my first choice was the astronomy department, but only a few people were recruited, so I failed. Beijing University of Political Science and Law was my last choice. My grades were up to standard and I was admitted.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In your time What is college like? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;I entered school in 1962. The schooling system was first 5 years and then changed to 4 years. , mainly studied political and legal subjects. In the first two years, he studied Marxism and criticized revisionism. During this period, he also organized a trip to Emei County, Sichuan (now Emeishan City) to carry out the "Four Clean-ups" movement. After graduating from college, I was assigned to Guangxi, but the receiving unit in Guangxi sent a telegram: "Please postpone your registration." This was postponed for two years. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; When you went to Guangxi two years later, what impressed you most? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;I just arrived at my workplace in Guangxi. I haven’t settled in yet and haven’t unpacked my luggage yet. The leader organized employees to beat gongs and drums and send me to the countryside to receive education from poor and lower-middle peasants and undergo labor training. ;

;

;I was assigned to a village on the China-Vietnam border, eating and living with farmers.

;

;I live on the lower floor of the building, with the soles of my feet facing the cowshed. The space under my bed is not wasted, and I have a litter of puppies, which are close to my ears. It's the chicken coop next door. At three or four o'clock in the morning, a cow started to defecate. The smell of feces was steaming, and it immediately spread to the entire building. Then the dog under my bed also started to defecate. These are small things. I clean up dog excrement every morning. Cow dung smells bad, but it doesn’t touch my body. The most difficult thing is the rooster, which makes me unable to rest.

; Like a decent and authentic farmer.

;

;My biggest achievement in rural Guangxi is that I endured hunger and hardship, tempered my perseverance, and laid a solid foundation for my subsequent development in life.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When did you decide to participate? Postgraduate examination? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;After two years in the countryside, I returned to the county and later Go to rural areas and serve as a member of the basic humanities education team. Although I went to college, I had no room for improvement and felt that my personal future was bleak. On the other hand, I have a strong sense of ruralism and cannot leave my hometown, so I still want to return to the north for development. ;

;

;One ​​day in 1977, my wife suddenly asked someone to bring me a message from the county seat, saying that the country wanted to recruit graduate students. I learned about it and it was indeed an opportunity. But I didn’t study very well in college. I stayed in the countryside for another 10 years without reading newspapers or listening to the radio. I thought at that time that the number of undergraduates we graduated in 1962 was more than 400. If we add those who graduated two or three years ago, there would be more than 1,000. Many of these people have married and established businesses, and many have become leaders and have stable incomes and families. Therefore, there are definitely not many people who applied for the exam, probably only a hundred or so. I decided to give it a try and reported it to the county leader. He was very supportive and let me go back to the county to prepare for the exam.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After all, put down the book for ten How many years have passed, how to prepare for the exam? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;There was only two months of preparation time. The first problem was, I I can't find any books, especially no professional books to read. ;

;

;Another problem is English. The English I learned in college is basically wasted. I borrowed junior high school textbooks and started learning from ABCD. I was completely unsure. After studying for two or three months, I thought I had made some progress and was ready to take the exam.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Then how to deal with it in the end What about the exam? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;The day before the exam, I was still memorizing textbooks, the 1975 Constitution and the Some newspaper articles. God helped me with the exam questions. I remember that the title of the essay at that time was "Follow Chairman Hua on the New Long March", and the legal theory examination question only had five words - "The French Civil War". ;

;

;Leading the new Long March, the compositions are all relatively familiar political discourse. Naturally, whether it will be difficult for the candidates depends on their personal performance.

;

;During the preparation for the exam, I borrowed some Marxist-Leninist books. I have repeatedly read the articles about proletarian revolution and proletarian dictatorship in the book, such as "Critique of the Gotha Program" and "The French Civil War", and have gained a lot of experience, so it is natural to answer the jurisprudence exam questions smoothly.

;

;I was left with no knowledge of English, so I was happy as soon as I opened the test paper. It was an English report from the "People's Daily" about learning from Dazhai in agriculture. I don’t speak English well, but I am very familiar with the feats of Dazhai people in transforming the world and the professional terms involved.

;

;For example, if you were asked to translate "seven ditches and eight beams", I don't know the English words for "gou" and "liang", but when I saw "seven (seven)" )" and "eight", I immediately knew that this must be Qigou Baliang, and I passed the English test at this time.

;

;After the adoption of the 1982 Constitution, "little fame"

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Is life as a graduate student different from what you imagined? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;Goed to school on September 1, 1978, and registered at the Law Institute of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences Later, I discovered that there was no school building for graduate students. The school leaders went to Beijing Normal University to borrow space. We built a simple classroom with linoleum in the open space between other people's buildings, and borrowed the building to use as a dormitory, with 8 people in one room. This is how study and life at the postgraduate level are settled. ;

;

;More than a year later, the Graduate School of the Academy of Social Sciences also found it inconvenient, so they asked us to move out and live in Beijing No. 11 School again. go. Usually, we go to the School of Law of the Academy of Social Sciences for classes and come back after class. I study for 12 hours a day, exercise for 2 hours in the morning and evening, and sleep for 6 hours. After studying hard for three years, my academic performance was quite good, and the school leaders were quite satisfied with it. After graduating with a master's degree in 1980, I stayed at the law school to work.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;This is related to undergraduate graduation Later I was assigned to work in rural areas of Guangxi, and my experience was completely different. ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;That’s true, especially when I entered the work and formulated 82 Working on the Constitution. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; What specific jobs have you been involved in? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;The work of amending the Constitution was mainly led by the then Deputy Chairman of the Legislative Affairs Committee of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress. The director, Mr. Zhang Youyu, is in charge, and a secretariat is set up to be responsible for research and drafting work. At that time, Wang Shuwen, director of the Institute of Law of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, was a member of the Secretariat, so Zhang Youyu naturally handed over some of the academic research and data preparation work of the Secretariat directly to Wang Shuwen. Every time Wang Shuwen received a task, he hurried back to the law school and called all the staff to divide the work. ;

;

;The five of us are generally not allowed to leave the unit and stick to our jobs 24 hours a day. As soon as they come, we are instructed to conduct research immediately and write research day and night. Report, at that time we could only take a brief rest in the office. It was late at night, and we bought a bowl of instant noodles to eat by ourselves. At that time, it was difficult to find information, and the academic world was in a state of desolation. There were books transferred from Tsinghua University and Peking University in the law school. No one had read them for more than 20 years. The dust was an inch thick, so I dug through the dust to look for information. From the beginning of preparations in 1980 to the completion of the constitutional amendment in 1982, we persisted in this way for more than two years.

;

;The process of constitution-making is complicated. We are only doing the most preliminary work. After the report is submitted, experts from the Secretariat will collect opinions from all parties and then bring it up to the leadership level. After the draft was passed, the People's Daily published a total of three solicitations for opinions. At that time, people were very enthusiastic about participation, and they may have hoped that through the formulation and implementation of the Constitution, the social disorder and national chaos like the "Cultural Revolution" could be ended forever. During the public participation in the discussion, more than 3,000 opinions were collected, and some people even suggested which words and punctuation should be used.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Participated in the formulation of the 1982 Constitution Has the related work had any impact on you personally? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;; After the adoption of the 82 Constitution, the Constitution suddenly became a major event that attracted national attention. First of all, there was a lot of publicity. At that time, even "little minions" like me published hundreds of articles on tofu cubes in newspapers. Publishing houses have also requested manuscripts from us, from leaders to experts to little people like us. I was extensively involved in publishing dozens of pamphlets promoting the new constitution. In the process, I became "a little famous". ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; Speaking of Mr. Zhang Youyu, what special impression do you have of him? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;Because of the amendment of the Constitution, I had contact with Mr. Zhang Youyu, who was eight years old at the time. When he was more than ten years old, he thought the articles I wrote were more interesting, so he liked to ask me to help him write manuscripts, and then he would revise them. I actually took on the job of his writing secretary. ;

;

;Around 1982, leaders of the State Council advocated the cultivation of academic successors by several senior experts in the traditional "master-apprentice" format. Mr. Zhang Youyu chose me at that time.

;

;After more than a year of studying, the country changed the inherited master-apprentice model and officially changed it to a modern doctoral education system. I took the state-mandated doctoral examination, which included jurisprudence, constitutional law, English and politics. I was the only candidate and thus became his doctoral candidate.

;

;;As a scholar, we must maintain a "normal mind";

;

;< strong>;Southern Weekend:;;You studied constitutional law with Mr. Zhang. How did you later pay specific attention to constitutional supervision? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;Because after the implementation of the 1982 Constitution, it is only a textual legal provision. However, whether the implementation process of government agencies is just and rational, and whether the implementation and supervision mechanism of the Constitution are scientific, all need to be continued to study. Naturally, I entered into the study of the theory of constitutional supervision. Judicialization of constitutional supervision has been my main focus for more than ten years. I have published three books, one of which is my revised and expanded doctoral thesis. ;

;

;The fate of constitutional law is to deal with the highest power of the country. At that time, I strongly advocated changing the Legal Committee of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress into the Constitution and Law Committee. This was proposed by me, and was repeatedly demonstrated by generations of constitutional scholars. In 2018, the "Constitution and Law Committee" was finally established in the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What do you think about academics? Relations with politics? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;Academics cannot be separated from society, nor can they be completely isolated from politics. There are quite a few scholars who place their main academic interests and attention on directly serving real-life politics and law. This is understandable. Of course, people need to study practical problems. This is also a university knowledge, and it is a more difficult knowledge. ;

;

;;The problem is that people who do this kind of knowledge should adjust their mentality. You must be mentally prepared that not all research reports and suggestions for improvement that address practical issues should or may be accepted and adopted by the relevant political decision-making bodies. We have said that theoretical conclusions and political decisions do not always coincide. Theoretically, it is necessary to study physics carefully and observe the subtle details, while in politics, it is necessary to weigh the pros and cons, pursue advantages and avoid disadvantages. The two stand on different positions and pursue different value goals, so the conclusions and decisions will naturally be different. As a scholar, it is important to maintain a "normal mind." It is naturally a happy and encouraging thing to have your opinions adopted. Even if your opinions are not adopted, you should not feel disappointed or discouraged. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; As far as you're concerned, what's the fun in learning? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;My book has been published. If someone reads it and experiences it, do you think it’s good? Just accept it, if it’s not good then reject it. However, we do not consider its impact when doing scholarship. That is a matter of whether contemporaries and future generations agree with it. It may be thirty or fifty years before anyone is interested in reading the book I wrote in depth. I know that at that time there was a scholar who had done such research and had such advanced ideological understanding. I don’t expect anyone of this generation to understand. ;

;

;;Doing academic work is not only for gaining practical benefits, but also for learning. "Liangzhizhi" and a means to support my family. In addition to doing academic work, I also want to increase my knowledge. I groped forward according to my own research ideas, had the courage to explore, studied all my life, and was willing to be lonely. I would never be moved by the trend or follow the trend. So I laughed at myself at a certain society and said that I was a lonely ghost in the academic world. ;

;

;;I just want to learn this knowledge thoroughly and achieve what I think As mature as you are, you can enjoy it. My students said that 30 years later, they are still studying the topic of "constitutional supervision" that I studied at the time. Because the research task of constitutional supervision has a long way to go. In my academic career, I have gone through a meaningful and tortuous path. If I can achieve the ultimate in this aspect of knowledge, it will be a blessing to be able to masturbate. ;

;

;;;"For this reason I am";;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Nowadays, young people, whether they are looking for a job or taking postgraduate entrance examinations, are facing fierce competition, and they are also relatively confused. . What advice do you have for young people? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;I have taught at Beijing Normal University for seven or eight years, and I have a deep understanding of this situation. When a master's degree or doctorate is admitted, the first thing to do is to take exams, such as judicial qualification certificate, computer certificate, IELTS, etc. You have to take five or six certificates in three years, so how can you have time to study and read? Now that you've almost passed the certification exam, it's time to send out your resume and look for a job. He waited until two weeks before the defense of his master's thesis before he hurriedly put together the paper, and its quality can be imagined. I always tell students that if they study well, they will not have to worry about finding a job in the future, and gold will shine. This society must always be supported by people with knowledge and vision. But secondly, the competition in society is so fierce that people will be unemployed immediately after graduation. Nowadays, many people deliver food after graduating from Ph.D., which is very realistic. If you set your starting point so low in the beginning and just find a job to support your family, how can our society progress? In the past, we talked about "I think, therefore I am", but now I think it is "I am, therefore I am". The reason why you are who you are is because of the things you have done. Personal self-realization and success always require a lot of effort or even a lifetime of effort. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What do you think of the current master's and doctoral training system? ? ;

;

;;Chen Yunsheng:;;I think our current training system is a kind of indoctrination education, and it is strict and strict. out. When I was studying for a Ph.D., the teachers only had one class every three to five weeks. They mainly relied on themselves to go out to listen to lectures and academic conferences, and tried their best to expand their knowledge. When I was studying in the United States, the school invited a professor from another school or our own school to give a keynote speech during lunch every day. Others listened while eating, or put down their knives and forks and raised their hands to ask questions, and no minute was wasted. Today’s students are also less active in participating in academic activities. Therefore, the main difference between the current and previous training models is that one is indoctrination and the other is heuristic; one is open and the other is closed. ;

; Sat, 18 Nov 2023 12:25:04 +0800 江苏205国道将收费引质疑：公共福利易涨难降，能否推进有待观察丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/260825
;;2023-11-18 11:00:00;
;

;Recently, a toll station was built on the Huai'an section of 205 National Highway in Suqian, Jiangsu, and the news that vehicle tolls will be collected soon has aroused social concern. great concern and doubt.

;

;According to China Jiangsu Net, on October 20, the Jiangsu Provincial Government approved that after the Suhuai Toll Station of National Highway 205 is completed and meets the traffic conditions, it will be managed as a government loan repayment road and jointly operated by Suqian and Huaian. Charges have been set and the charging standards for various types of vehicles have been determined, ranging from 10 yuan to 50 yuan. Media reports indicate that the toll station has been built. This means that tolls may be activated on this section of the national highway at any time.

;

;New toll stations on national highways! Many people believe that this is contrary to the country's policy of gradually canceling ordinary highway toll stations in recent years. However, the Jiangsu Provincial Transportation Department stated that the toll collection of first-class highways for which the government repays loans complies with the policy.

;

;According to the current "Toll Road Management Regulations", roads constructed by the government using loans or paid funds raised from enterprises and individuals can collect tolls upon approval. The Suqian and Huai'an sections of National Highway 205 were built with government loans. According to the Jiangsu Transportation Department, this section still has nearly 1 billion yuan in debt to be repaid.

;

;After sorting out the historical context of the Suhuai Toll Station on National Highway 205, we can find that the toll collection on this section is not a recent decision. In the early 2010s, the Suqian and Huai'an sections of National Highway 205 were successively renovated and expanded and upgraded to first-class highways. In 2014, the Jiangsu Provincial Government approved in a document the establishment of a toll station at the junction of National Highway 205 Huai'an and Suqian, and the two cities will jointly charge fees. In 2018, the Jiangsu Provincial Development and Reform Commission approved the feasibility report for the construction of the toll station. Today, the toll station is built and the provincial government issues documents approving the toll.

;

;In the minds of many people, only expressways still charge tolls, and all other ordinary highway toll stations have been abolished. However, in fact, there are not only ordinary highway toll stations, but they have increased in the past two years. According to information released on the official website of the Jiangsu Provincial Department of Transportation, as of December 2022, there are still more than 10 national and provincial highway toll stations in Jiangsu Province. Also on National Highway 205, more than 90 kilometers north of Suhuai Toll Station, there is Xinyi Toll Station.

;

;According to the National Toll Road Statistical Bulletin of the Ministry of Transport, at the end of 2021, there were 308 first-level highway main line toll stations and 115 second-level highway main line toll stations across the country. Compared with the end of the previous year, there were 308 second-level highway main line toll stations. The number of toll stations decreased by 7, but there were 8 more toll stations on first-class highways. The total mileage of tolled first-class highways was 17,600 kilometers, an increase of more than 200 kilometers over the previous year. Media reports show that since 2022, at least 7 new national highway toll stations have been added in various provinces.

;

;However, in recent years, it has become a trend to cancel tolls on ordinary highways. The central government has repeatedly proposed reducing road transportation costs and reducing road and bridge tolls. As early as 2009, the National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Transport and the Ministry of Finance jointly issued a document calling for the gradual and orderly elimination of tolls on secondary roads for government loan repayment. The revised draft of the "Toll Road Management Regulations" released in 2018 stipulates that the construction of new first- and second-level toll roads and independent bridges and tunnels will be stopped, and only expressways can collect tolls. However, this revision has not yet been completed. In 2020, the General Office of the State Council forwarded the "Implementation Opinions on Further Reducing Logistics Costs" from the National Development and Reform Commission and the Ministry of Transport, once again requesting to ensure that the overall burden of truck tolls is not increased. Under these policies, a large number of toll plazas have been eliminated across the country.

;

;Therefore, although Jiangsu’s new 205 National Highway Suhuai Toll Station collects fees, it is not impossible to rely on it. Although the project was established based on loans for road construction and toll repayment at the beginning of the reconstruction and expansion, the funds mainly came from banks. Loans, and there are still huge loans that have not been repaid, but this is now and then. In the early 2010s, the construction and reconstruction of first- and second-level toll roads was still allowed, but after a few years the policy has changed. Except for expressways, the central government has discouraged and even explicitly proposed to stop the construction of first- and second-level toll roads, and many places have also canceled them. A large number of toll stations on primary and secondary roads have been installed. Especially in the past year or two, due to the impact of the epidemic, the economy is struggling to recover. Under such circumstances, adding new toll stations and increasing public transportation costs will of course be questioned by the public.

;

;Although there is no explicit regulation, "national highways, provincial highways and other ordinary highways should be free of charge" has become "common sense" in the public mind, just like highways are free on holidays. Once this kind of psychological expectation is formed, if you want to reverse it, you will certainly be questioned. It is easy to bring welfare from scratch, but it is difficult to bring it from existence to nothing. It is easy to go from paid to free, but difficult to go from free to paid. If the previously charged service is changed to free, the public will think they have benefited. But conversely, if it was free before and now it has to be charged, everyone will feel that their interests have been violated.

;

;This is true not only in public policy, but also in business. Since the birth of the Internet, various services have been almost free for ordinary users. Netizens are accustomed to enjoying free services. Once charges start to be charged, they will of course feel very unhappy if they have to pay to watch videos or use large-capacity, high-speed download network disks. Broadband and data traffic have been charged from the beginning, and no one thinks these should be free.

;

;However, a truly free lunch does not actually exist. If you want to watch free videos, you have to endure a lot of ads; if you want to use a free network disk, you can only endure the download speed of a small water pipe. Likewise, public benefits also need to be paid for by someone. There are no tolls on national highways, and construction and maintenance costs are indispensable. They can only come from fiscal revenue such as taxes, which means taxpayers must pay for them. If the local government's fiscal revenue is sufficient, then of course it won't be a problem. But if finances are tight, I'm afraid we can only reduce spending on road construction and maintenance, or consider charging fees.

;

;The Suhuai Toll Station of National Highway 205 is preparing to collect fees at this time, which may be related to the local financial difficulties in recent years. But it remains to be seen whether it can move forward after attracting huge attention and opposition. Although Suqian and Huai'an are in northern Jiangsu and are less economically developed than southern Jiangsu, they are still much more prosperous than many places in the west. There is still 1 billion in road construction loans, which may not be too big for local finances. of holes. What's more, Jiangsu, as the country's second largest economic province, should have enough financial resources to make transfer payments to local governments.

;

;However, if no tolls are allowed on national and provincial roads in the future, will the enthusiasm of local governments to build new roads be greatly reduced? This is also worth noting.

;

;Trieste in 1895. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Every time I pass through Trieste, I have to go and sit for a while in the ancient San Marco Cafe . This city has the best coffee in Italy, and the headquarters of Illy is here. Like many cities that were once glorious and then fell into silence, this city is half reality and half exists in words. Trieste was once the most important port of the Austro-Hungarian Empire and a blend of Slavic, Latin and Germanic cultures. More than a hundred kilometers away, Venice has kept the world's attention in a flashy way. Although every stone that built it came from elsewhere, and all the beauty is artificial, the first sight of Venice will make you wonder. One feels amazed and mesmerized. In comparison, Trieste is a sleepy city. She is located in the northeastern border of Italy, more than ten kilometers away in Slovenia. It faces the sea, backed by karst rocks, and under the mountains are checkerboard-like neighborhoods. There are many deep houses and compounds on the mountain.

;

;James Morris, an Englishman who served as a soldier here, later changed his gender and became Jane Morris. After World War II, she wrote full-time and became a reporter for The Guardian and a famous travel writer. In her book "Trieste and the Meaning of Nowhere" (Trieste and the Meaning of Nowhere), Trieste is an unforgettable city, but when she tried to remember it, she found that it was like an unforgettable city. Presented face. This city has no unforgettable scenery, no unique food, and it doesn’t even have an Italian flavor. In a 1999 survey, 70% of Italians didn’t even know that this city belongs to Italy.

;

;Despite this, Trieste also has her unique charm. This former free port chose to be included in Italy during the dispute between Yugoslavia and Italy in the last century. The chaotic past can stimulate people's imagination and reflection. She is more literary than any other city. At the beginning of the last century, Joyce lived in many places in this city. He worked as an English teacher and began to write "Ulysses" here. For him, Trieste was a particularly draining place for his liver. Joyce interacted with the melancholy Italo Svevo, encouraged the Jewish businessman to write, and highly praised his "Zeno's Consciousness". Svevo's writing has a slowness that is rare in Italian. Most of the writing is about a businessman questioning his own conscience, which complements the thoughtfulness of a stream-of-consciousness novel.

;

;There is also a kind of continuity in the literature of this city. The writings of contemporary Trieste writer Claudio Magris also have the melancholy of Svevo, and his works are very similar to It was translated from German into Italian, which is not surprising since Magris is a professor of German literature at the university.

;

;If a writer wants to present a city, it is actually difficult to capture its spirit and soul. Magris has been telling stories about the land. As the most important seaport in the Austro-Hungarian Empire, Trieste's once glorious history made her current situation look bleak, and the entire city was shrouded in a twilight. Magris's writing is, in a sense, a pursuit of Trieste's literary tradition and an attempt to get closer to reality. His "Micro World", which won the "Strega" award but is difficult to classify, has many texts related to the space of the city and the literature of the past.

;

;It is difficult for a person with limited life experience to establish a deep connection with the vast world. Sociologist Xiang Biao proposed the concept of "nearness". Magris is an example of practicing "neighborhood". He lives in this city and uses the tenacity of a scholar to understand the place and penetrate deeply into the life here. His "miniature world" actually consists of cafes, parks and Sacré Coeur. After reading his "Micro World" and then seeing the San Marco Cafe, the park and the nearby Sacré Coeur, you will recognize everything and feel that the world is what he described. The San Marco Cafe, which opened in 1914, has a very high ceiling with leaves and coffee beans on the top. The ebony bar and the wine racks against the wall stand firmly there. You will recognize the mask behind the counter. There is a The golden coffee machine with the flying eagle logo and the lion-shaped table legs under the table are reminiscent of Saint Mark, the patron saint of Venice.

;

;The city’s ancient cafes resist the times in their own way. In the San Marco Cafe, the bar is still made of solemn dark wood, and the tables, chairs and wall decorations are still the same as a hundred years ago. One side of its "L"-shaped structure has been transformed into a bookstore, filled with nostalgic books. The most conspicuous place is Magris's "Micro Worlds", which has dozens of pages describing the past and present of the San Marco Café. The café is the living room of the city, an open public space where some faces disappear and new ones appear. In this urban space, the history of literature here is recorded. Cafe San Marco is a place frequented by literary "pilgrims". Everyone, in their own way, hopes that this cultural "ark" will continue to exist. In addition to drinking coffee, you can also eat exquisite pasta in this cafe.

;

;After coming out of the cafe, you can go for a walk in the nearby park to get some fresh air. There are towering plane trees in the park, and the sun shines through the leaves, and the golden light falls on a pool in the garden, which Magris also described. There are benches everywhere in the garden, where people read newspapers, books, or just sit around. There is a children's playground and an open-air cinema at the end of the park. Statues of city celebrities are scattered around, including a bust of Joyce wearing a hat and glasses, which was erected on the centenary of his birth in 1982, and a bust of local poet Saba, a second-hand bookseller of Jewish origin. , a neurotic patient and the cultural soul of Trieste, once wrote a poem titled "Trieste":

;

;;I walked through the whole city,;

;

;;climbed a large Slope,;

;

;;It was crowded at first, but then the road became empty. ;

;

;;At the end of the road is a low wall:;

;

;< span style="font-family: Kaiti, Kaiti_GB2312, STKaiti;">;I am sitting alone in this small corner. ;

;

;;Where the low wall ends,;

;

;;It is also where the city ends. ;

;

;;Trieste has an inaccessible beauty. ;

;

;;If you like, this city is like a rough, ;

; < p>;;Greedy wild child, ;

;

;;Having blue eyes and using a pair of overly large hands;

;

;;Sent A flower;;

;

;;Like a paragraph full of jealousy;

;

;< span style="font-family: Kaiti, Kaiti_GB2312, STKaiti;">;'s love. ;

;

;;On this hillside, I see the city (Trieste);

;

;;Every church, every street, even the crowded beach,;;

;;And the top of the mountain is full of rocks;

;

;;The last house seems to be firmly rooted there. ;

;

;;Everything around me;

;

;;all have a strange, tortured feeling,;

;

;;This is the smell of hometown (this is where I was born). ;

;

;;Every part of my city is full of life;

;

; ;She reserved a corner for me, suitable for me;

;

;;A worried and lonely life. ;

;

;Everyone lives in the corners of the city, including poets like Saba. The city has beaches, hills, and therefore a hint of countryside. Watching life from above, but not participating in it, while not feeling like an outsider, is exactly what this city offers Saba. Magris lives in this city in another way. He exists in a strict ritual, as cautious and solemn as the black and white marble floor of the Sacre Coeur. For him, everything was close by, a trip to the park was like traveling around the world, the clear cistern of the Sacre Coeur was like a spring in the glade, and the dim light of the church was as deep as the sea at night. Unfathomable. His life permeates the San Marco Cafe, the Park in the Street and the Sacred Heart Church two steps away. Magris even designed a reassuring ending for himself: with the comfort of his two sons, he lives in the Sacred Heart Church. In the golden sky painted by the church, jump through the ring of fire held by two angels.

;

;The Trieste described by Magris is a city of twilight. In 2019, when he was 80 years old, he published "The Bent Time of Krems". This is a book about twilight. There are five short stories in the book, telling the stories of five men in their twilight years.

;

;In "The Concierge", there is an old man who is reluctant to advance but to retreat, a president who once owned several companies. He enters an unknown field to get rid of the reality of facing enemies on all sides. He is a Czech who walked from the interior to Trieste for development. When he was young, the world was beautiful and big. He played his role successfully, building himself a strong armor with checks and profits. However, one day, his desire for success and inner panic left him. He became relaxed, sold his company, and became a concierge of an apartment with a calm mood. Once the sea has returned to the waterside safely. He tries to avoid roads where he can see the sea in the morning, takes the bus, and then walks to work.

;

;The protagonist of "Music Lesson" is a Polish Jew who has entered his twilight years, a survivor with shame. He takes a car to go up the mountain to the home of his former student. The student, who became a musical master, showed him a piece of music he had composed as a tribute to the tragedy of the Jews, and he accepted the piece with embarrassment.

;

;The protagonist in "Bent Time in Krems" is the closest thing to Magris. He gives a lecture on Kafka and has dinner in a city called Krems. At the dinner party, someone mentioned Noni, the goddess of his youth, and by chance, he actually contacted her later. The "now" changes the "before", time becomes curved, and all that is left is "his" longing for the god-like Noni.

;

;"Awarding" is about an old writer attending a literary awards ceremony, feeling melancholy and relieved as time passes. In "Outing Day", an old man went to the set to see the actor who played him in his youth. Everything was different from the previous story, and the old man got a kiss that he missed when he was a teenager. The five fragments of life are all based on the theme of "old age", allowing people to see the scene of the city's twilight reflecting on life: the sunset fills the sky, and everything tends to be relieved. Magris uses short words to accurately outline some life fragments. The past and present coexist at the same time, and death becomes infinitely gentle.

;

;In addition to Magris, there is also a world-class best-selling female writer Susana Tamaro among the contemporary writers in Trieste. Most Italian families have her book "Where the Heart Guidance" 》. It was also a woman in her twilight years who was reckoning with the past through letters. There is also a writer recently introduced to the country - Gianfranco Kaligaric, who has certain connections with Trieste. He was born in Asmara, Eritrea, Africa. His family is a "cosmopolitan" family from Trieste, and he carries traces of the city's ethnic mix. He lived and worked in Milan and Rome. In 1974, he wrote the highly praised "Waste of Summer". There is an indelible trace of youthful debauchery in his style, which still exudes endless charm.
