;

;On November 13, 2023, the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the State Supervision Commission publicly announced the handling of disciplinary and law violations by Xiong Xue, the former deputy mayor of Chongqing. Situation: Expelled from the party and transferred to the procuratorate for review and prosecution.

; Remain consistent and address many issues such as "seven things" and formalism.

;

;"Seven principles" was proposed at the Fourth Plenary Session of the 18th CPC Central Committee held in October 2014. The specific content is, "Some people ignore the Party's For the sake of their so-called official career and their so-called influence, some engage in nepotism and exclude dissidents, some engage in gangs and cliques, and some engage in anonymous false accusations and rumors. In other words, there are those who try to win people's hearts and votes, there are those who appoint officials and make wishes and celebrate with others, there are those who do things on their own and act against the will, there are also those who try to make mistakes and make unreasonable comments about the central government, and so on."

; < p style="text-align: left;">;Before Xiong Xue was dismissed, many central management cadres had been characterized as "seven qualities", such as Zhou Jiankun, former vice chairman of the Guizhou Provincial Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, and former chairman of the Standing Committee of the Jiangxi Provincial People's Congress. Deputy Director Gong Jianhua and others.

;

;This is the second time this year that Xiong Xue’s name has appeared on the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection. Half a year ago, on May 11, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection announced on its website that Xiong Xue was suspected of serious violations of discipline and law and was undergoing disciplinary review and supervisory investigation by the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the National Supervisory Commission. This also makes him the 19th central management cadre to be dismissed in 2023, and the "second tiger" to be dismissed from Chongqing after the 20th National Congress of the Communist Party of China.

;

;Before Xiong Xue fell, more signs had been revealed.

;

;;Failed to pass the National People's Congress qualification review;

;

;Born in Xiong Xue, who grew up in Chongqing, is a typical "local cadre".

;

;After graduating from the Chinese major of Chongqing No. 1 Normal School in Sichuan Province in 1982, Xiong Xue entered the Chongqing Nan'an District Committee and served successively as the mayor of Chongqing Jiangjin City and the Municipal Party Committee. He is the deputy director of the High-tech Zone Management Committee (director level) and director of the Chongqing Municipal Development and Reform Commission. He is in charge of education, science and technology, and was promoted to deputy mayor of the Chongqing Municipal People's Government in May 2019.

;

;Since the beginning of 2023, Xiong Xue has suffered setbacks one after another.

;

;On January 17, 2023, the new Chongqing Municipal Government leadership team was made public. Xiong Xuewei was re-elected as deputy mayor, but continued to serve as a member of the municipal government party group . On the morning of the same day, at the third plenary session of the Sixth Chongqing Municipal People's Congress, Xiong Xue was elected as a representative of the 14th National People's Congress. However, a month later, on February 24, the National People’s Congress website released a representative qualification review report, and Xiong Xue and other three people failed to pass.

;

;Before and after the National People's Congress confirmed his qualifications as a representative, Xiong Xue briefly continued to appear in public as a "member of the Party Leadership Group of Chongqing Municipal People's Government." On March 13, 2023, Xiong Xue also went to Wansheng Economic Development Zone to investigate the operation of industrial enterprises and energy supply guarantee work, and proposed to solve the urgent, difficult and anxious problems of enterprises and continue to optimize and improve the business environment. But this was also the last time Xiong Xue appeared in public reports.

;

;Southern Weekend reporter's search found that they also failed to pass the National People's Congress qualification review. Except for Xiong Xue, who was notified of being investigated, the other two people were not reported to have been actually investigated. Impact and is still working normally today.

;

;Looking back at past public speeches, Xiong Xue has repeatedly emphasized the importance of "party conduct and clean government" and "anti-corruption" work.

;

;In a survey conducted after he was appointed Secretary of the Chongqing Yongchuan District Party Committee in 2013, he emphasized the need to further enhance the people’s trust and satisfaction in the Party committee and government. We must do a good job in building a clean and honest government, strengthen education, supervision, and punishment to prevent corruption. In June 2020, when the Discipline Inspection Commission and Supervision Office of Chongqing High-tech Zone were officially unveiled, he also gave a speech, proposing to play the role of demonstration and leadership of leading cadres, take the lead in respecting the law and abiding by the law, and stand the test in small matters and details.

;

;However, judging from the investigation by the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, Xiong Xue failed to complete the above requirements.

;

;The report mentioned that Xiong Xue accepted banquets and services that may affect the fair execution of official duties, accepted gifts and gifts in violation of regulations, obtained large returns through private loans, and was in conflict with Unscrupulous businessmen collude, engage in power-for-money transactions, take advantage of their positions to benefit others in project contracting, land approval, etc., illegally receive huge amounts of property, and fail to explain truthfully when organizing interviews and inquiries, among many other problems.

;

;;"Seven Things" is essentially a political issue;

;

;Xiong Xue is the third central management cadre to be clearly pointed out in the past two years for engaging in "seven things".

;

;Zhou Jiankun, the former vice chairman of the Guizhou Provincial Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, who was "double-opened" in June 2023, was accused of losing his ideals and beliefs, losing the people's position, abandoning his duties and mission, and implementing Ineffective implementation of the Party Central Committee’s major decisions and arrangements on poverty alleviation and the consolidation and expansion of poverty alleviation results, use of poverty alleviation projects for personal gain, serious damage to the interests of the Party and the people, failure to fulfill the main responsibility of comprehensively and strictly governing the Party, implementation of “seven things”, and confrontation Organizational review, etc.

;

;Gong Jianhua, the former deputy director of the Standing Committee of the Jiangxi Provincial People's Congress who was "double fired" in 2022, was accused of losing his ideals and beliefs, abandoning his duties and mission, and betraying the "two "Maintain", organize "small circles" and "small gangs", engage in "seven things", pollute the political ecology, fail to implement the Party Central Committee's decisions and arrangements on trade union work, secretly manipulate the selection of model workers, and privatize the honor of the party and the country. Give and receive, etc.

;

;

;News on the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the State Supervision Commission on September 16, 2020 stated: Former Deputy Chairman of the Internal Affairs and Judicial Committee of the Twelfth National People's Congress, Yunnan Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China Former Secretary Qin Guangrong "publicly made remarks that were contrary to the requirements for comprehensive and strict governance of the party", and Meng Hongwei, former member of the Party Committee and Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Public Security and former director of the China Coast Guard, "refused to implement the decision of the Party Central Committee"... ; Sat, 18 Nov 2023 08:25:06 +0800 你家附近借书便利吗？期盼普及社区借阅服务http://www.infzm.com/contents/260844

;

;After reading the limited collection of books at home, when I felt that there were no books to read and life was difficult, Xiao Xu called Called and said he wanted to send me a book.

;

;Xiao Xu is my former colleague. He knows that I like reading. I have given them away several times before, and each time they were several large copies. I was embarrassed to ask him to give it away again, so I politely declined.

;

;I have two major hobbies, one is walking and the other is reading. Walking refreshes me and reading makes my life fulfilling. If I don't take a walk for a day, I feel uncomfortable all over; if I don't read for a day, my life will be boring. Reading a few pages of books every day has long become a habit of life. If you don't touch a book on a certain day, you won't feel good even if you sleep.

;

;In the past few years, most of the books I read were borrowed from the university library by my son. My son is studying in a local university. This has a great advantage for me, that is, I can use the university library as my own private library. This is all because of my son. Now that my son has graduated from college and is working, I have lost the convenience of studying. After my son left school, the source of books suddenly stopped. I had to rummage through boxes and cabinets at home and come up with the idea of ​​collecting books.

;

;But the collection of books at home was too limited and could not meet my needs, so there was a book shortage. The days without books to read feel particularly long and endless. At this moment, Xiao Xu called and wanted to deliver a book. I was secretly happy, but at the same time, I felt that I couldn't always be in debt to others. Books are expensive nowadays, and Xiao Xu is just a working-class person, so how can he keep asking people to spend money? No matter how strong the relationship is, it must be measured. So I thought, it would be great if there was a place to borrow books.

;

;Actually, it’s not that there is no borrowing office. You can borrow books from the city’s library, but it’s a pity that the place is not close to home. It’s more than ten miles away from home. In this way, it is natural to think, wouldn’t it be great if you could borrow books near your home? For example, community libraries, etc. But I couldn’t find such a place, and when I asked people, they said they had never heard of it.

;

;My son joked that if we buy a house in the future, we will buy it near the library. Even if this kind of joke can come true, it will only be a long way away. They say we want to create a scholarly society, but even borrowing books is difficult. What can we do to create a better society?

;

;I admit that fewer and fewer people read paper books now. But even so, the public services that should be provided must be provided and cannot be omitted. We often say that we need to provide all-inclusive assistance to needy groups, and we also need to provide all-inclusive assistance for reading, because there are always people who cannot afford to buy too many books, and there are always people who face the high price of books and have to give them up after considering them again and again. Even if you can't let go, you can only reluctantly give up.

;

;Let reading enter our daily life and become an important part of life, thereby improving individual quality and the population quality of the entire society. This is the fundamental essence of creating a scholarly society. Not to mention anything else, just for this reason, we also need a place where people can borrow books nearby. Such a place does not need to be big, it just needs to be convenient for people to borrow. At least one community committee must have such a place. In large communities, the number of places must be determined based on population distribution. In addition, in order to save costs, books can be regularly transferred between different places to maximize the use of books and satisfy the needs to the greatest extent. The needs of readers. I don't know if such a wish can be implemented in reality.

;

;(The author is a citizen of Anqing City, Anhui Province)

; Fri, 17 Nov 2023 23:25:03 +0800 雪国芭蕉——松尾芭蕉“奥之细道”行迹（五）丨最深之水http://www.infzm.com/contents/260812

;

;;

;

;The Matsuo Basho Monument at Inari Shrine in Niigata Prefecture, left picture taken in April 2023 month, the picture on the right was taken in September 2023. ;(Photo courtesy of the author);

;

;After walking several points on Matsuo Basho’s “Oku no Homichi” in the fall of 2019, Then came three years of COVID. It's like a big dream.

;

;In early April and early September 2023, in early spring and early autumn, I went to Niigata Prefecture in northern Japan twice, the Echigo country that often appears in ancient Japanese literature. Echigo Kingdom, one of the ancient ;Reiji Kingdom; in Japan, faces the ;Sea of ​​Japan; and is long and narrow from north to south. ;Meiji; Four years later, the feudal domain was abolished and a prefecture was established, named Niigata.

;

;In Niigata in April, the car was driving among the continuous farmland. The brown rice fields in early spring have just been plowed and are waiting for a new round of sowing. The September trip is already in my plan, so I started imagining the scene of autumn. For large areas of solid color scenes, yellow is the most suitable, and the combination with the blue sky is pure and gorgeous. In the Chengdu Plain where I live, there is a spectacular scene every day in March. The spread of rapeseed flowers is spectacular, and the atmosphere of early spring is quite exciting. Chengdu people who stay at home will basically go out for spring outings at this time, not to let down nature or themselves. Fortunately, I visited Niigata again in early September and enjoyed the sight of golden rice fields and blue sky.

;

;There are many swans in Niigata’s deserted fields in April. They are pecking at the grain that falls in the soil. After being fed and fattened, they will fly back to Siberia. It migrates like this every year.

;

;Look at these beautiful big white birds from a distance. Has Basho seen them?

;

;Probably not. Matsuo Basho and his disciple Soryo Kawai arrived in Echigo in the summer of 1689. Echigo is a stop on the "Oku no Hosomido". The entire "Oku no Homichi" journey is a total of 2,400 kilometers of hiking. Starting from Edo, go north, then turn west. It is said that the most magnificent journey is the monk Kukai’s tour of the eighty-eight temples in Shikoku.

;

;Before the trip to Japan in the spring of 2023, the excitement and yearning were mixed with a different state of mind from the trips in previous years. During the three years of the epidemic, except for a few short trips within the country, I have not traveled abroad. Three years of isolation has had a psychological effect on me, leaving me with a faint uneasiness, but I don’t know where this uneasiness comes from. When applied to the body, the hands and feet feel sluggish and sluggish. Having been separated from the same rhythm for three years, the effect is really powerful. The body is heavy and the state of mind is also sinking. I asked myself, what would happen if I never went out again? It seems to be possible. For middle-aged people, three years makes them look older. This is probably an important reason. By September, after a trip to Japan in April, a self-driving trip to Yunnan in May, and several short trips, I felt that my mind and body were beginning to adapt to the journey again, which was very gratifying.

;

;My friend Ding Yuan settled in the village of ;Niigata Prefecture; and ran a B&B called "Four Seasons Inn" with her husband, Mr. Nakamura Tatsuo. The couple also ran a local hotel. Various contents of travel. Regarding Basho, what Ding Yuan helped me find out is that Basho and Zeng Liang stayed in Murakami for two nights and three days.

;

;The Basho accommodation in Murakami can be checked and determined based on local literature, but it has lost its former appearance and has become a salmon restaurant, so the curtain at the door is very interesting. This is a two-story Japanese-style house on Murakami Street. Three Japanese-style curtains are hung side by side at the door. They are written in black on a white background and in the middle are "Izutsuya", which is the name of the restaurant. The one on the right is written "Murakami". "Salmon Cuisine" and a book on the left reads "Basho's Staying Place". There is a wooden sign at the door stating, "In June of the second year of Genroku (1689), Basho and Zeng Liang arrived at Murakami during their journey on the 'Oku no Homichi'. They stayed here for two nights and three days. , it was called 'Sukuzaemon' at the time." In order to show that the brand was not the store's own words, the signature was "Mura City Education Committee." Murakami's salmon industry is very famous. Every year, many salmon migrate here, and the output and quality are of high quality. Therefore, Murakami has a considerable number of salmon restaurants and processing workshops for curing and drying salmon. I asked Nakamura, is "Izutsuya" the most famous salmon shop in Murakami? Nakamura smiled and said, that's not necessarily true. It's because of the influence of bananas, but most people don't care about this, and only you cultural people care about it.

;

;;

;

;Matsuo Basho and his disciple Kawai Sora went to the accommodation in the village. ;(Photo courtesy of the author);

;

;Basho wrote in "The Thirty-Five Echigo Road" in "Oku no Hosomichi" , "As soon as we passed the Mouse Pass, we entered the territory of Echigo from Dewa, and then we rushed to Shizhen Pass in Etchu. We walked for nine days in total. During this period, sometimes the heat was unbearable, and sometimes the cold rain poured down on us, which made us physically and mentally exhausted. Even getting sick was really miserable. So I didn’t record much of my journey.”

;

;Perhaps because Basho was ill during Echigo, there are very few records about Echigo in "Oku no Hosomichi". Based on the results that Ding Yuan helped me check, I followed the traces in Murakami in early spring and early autumn. However, it is no longer possible to determine the location of this trace. We can only search for it based on the location of the Basho Sentence Monument.

;

;The Jizo-do Hall in Kamikata Town has the Basho sentence monument "けふはかり人も年よれ First Time Rain". It can be translated as: Only today do you know that you are old, this is the first shower.

;

;Inari Shrine has a Basho motto stone, "Cloud folds 々人をやすむる月见かな". The general meaning I understand is that the shadow of the cloud covers the moon, and the shadow of the moon covers the person. The latter is a sentence from Basho's seven-part collection "Spring Day", written in 1685. Basho visited Murakami in August 1689. He probably left no works due to poor health. Next to the Bajiao Monument Monument, there is a haiku poet Su Xian's Monument Stone. The handwriting is blurry. The general idea I read is: Under the moonlight, the shore of the water is covered with pine leaves like umbrellas (I don't know if it is correct or not). According to the introduction on the standing plaque next to it, these two stone sentences were erected in October 1843, during the 150th anniversary of Basho and the 17th anniversary of Susen. The introduction also specifically said that there are two important remains of Basho in Murakami, one is the Inari Shrine where this place is located, and the other is the Iwafune Shrine.

;

;The Iwafune Shrine built on the seaside is much larger in scale and momentum than the Inari Shrine. It has a red torii gate and a white torii gate. In front of the red torii gate, there is a Basho sentence stone, which is engraved with the sentence "On the seventh day of Hanasaki, Tsurumi will see Tsuruga", which can be understood as "The cherry blossoms are in full bloom in seven days, and only Tsurumi can see such a beautiful scenery." The Basho stone in front of the white torii gate is engraved with "Bunzuki や六日も长の夜には思ず", which means that the night of Bunzuki (July), when I am anxiously waiting for the letter, is also different from the ordinary night. The former Basho haiku has nothing to do with "Oku no Hosomichi", and the latter line is taken from a line written in the Hokuriku section of "Oku no Hosomichi".

;

;In April, the day before Basho’s tour in ;Niigata Prefecture;, we went to Kameoka Monju-in, the Daishoji Temple in Yamagata Prefecture. In the drizzle, there was still residual snow on the mountain col in the distance and on the roofs nearby. When I was going down the mountain, I suddenly found a Basho sentence monument standing on the roadside, which read "春の夜は桜に明けてしまひけり" (Spring night, cherry blossoms are in full bloom). Tateishiji Temple (Mountain Temple) in Yamagata Prefecture is an important place to visit on the "Oku no Hosōdo" tour of Master Basho and his apprentice. I visited in 2019. I don’t know if they have been to the Great Holy Temple, and it is not mentioned in the book. Someone may have studied the details of these travels, and the results of these studies must be carefully explored to know.

;

;I used to read a lot of haiku in Chinese translation, but over the years I slowly started to read the original haiku. It is true that poetry cannot be translated. Because my Japanese foundation is still shallow, and it also involves issues of ancient and modern Japanese, I can only read these haiku at a loss. But maybe it was in this confusion, after leaking some clear information, that I finally understood the extremely concise and complex semantics of haiku.

;

;The highlight of Basho's activities in this area of ​​​​Murakami is Otohoji Temple. During my two trips to Murakami in early spring and early autumn, I went to Otohoji Temple twice. The cherry blossom scenery in early spring is obviously much more beautiful than the scenery in early autumn before the red leaves appear. It is said to be Murakami, but Otohoji Temple is actually located in Tainai City next to Murakami. This temple was built in the 8th century AD under the order of Emperor Shomu who was in office at the time. The temple covers a vast area of ​​more than 80,000 square meters. There is a "three-story pagoda" built in 1620 in the temple, which is designated as a national important cultural property of Japan. This temple is the only ancient temple in Shinji that is included in "The Story of Konsai", and it is also the temple where Matsuo Basho once visited when he wandered the "Oku no Hosho Road".

;

;;

;

;Matsuo Basho Monument in Otohoji Temple. ;(Photo provided by the author);

;

;This is the topic, let me say a few words. It was almost noon after visiting Otohoji Temple in early autumn. Mr. Nakamura said that there was a steamed bun shop next to it that was very delicious and he hadn’t eaten there in a long time. We decided to leave it at that for lunch. When I arrived at the door, I looked at the description and found that it was founded in the first year of culture, which was 1804, and has a history of more than 200 years. The shop is really small, with a few stools and two or three tables. When the steamed buns arrived, they turned out to be red bean paste buns. Later, I looked up information and learned that in Japan, the so-called steamed buns are bean paste buns, and the outer shell can vary. There are white steamed buns made of commonly used flour, brown tea steamed buns made of wheat flour, and sweet potato flour, yam flour, and japonica rice flour. There are sweet potato steamed buns and wine steamed buns made from fermented rice flour, etc., but they are filled with red bean paste. Yiboji Steamed Buns are delicious, and I am even more impressed that such a snack shop has a history of more than 200 years. In Japan, I often come across various small shops that are hundreds of years old. I once ate at a ramen shop in Kyoto. When I came to the door after eating, I was shocked to see the signboard. It has a history of more than 400 years.

;

;I posted photos of my visit to Yibao Temple in WeChat Moments, and a friend asked: Is it the Yibao Temple in "The Story of the Past"? It seems that its name first came from "The Story of the Past".

;

;"The Story of the Past" is a collection of folklore stories from the late Heian period in Japan, with a total of thirty-one volumes and more than a thousand stories. It is divided into Tianzhu (India) (volumes one to five), Cathay (China) (volumes six to ten), and Honchao (Japan) (volumes eleven to thirty-one). The current Chinese version of this Dynasty was edited by Zhou Zuoren. The stories in "The Tale of the Past" are all-encompassing, with Buddhist stories and secular stories mixed together. There are also many stories of gods and supernatural beings. Many creations of later generations come from this book, which is one of the source treasures of Japanese literature. It is similar to Chinese books such as San Yan Er Pai and Strange Stories from a Chinese Studio. Because each volume contains the word "present and past" at the beginning, it is called "The Story of Present and Past".

;

;Among Japanese writers, Ryunosuke Akutagawa made full use of "The Story of Konsai Monogatari". It is said that about one-fifth of the material in the historical novels he created came from "The Story of Konsai Monogatari", including "Rason" Door" and "In the Jungle". Ryunosuke Akutagawa called "The Story of Konsai Monogatari" a "human comedy" in ancient Japan. He said that "The Story of Konsai Monogatari" is full of "wild beauty" and is "a kind of beauty that has nothing to do with elegance and luxury." Many of the common Onmyodo and Onmyoji content in Japanese animations also come from "Kanagi Monogatari".

;

;In the spacious garden of Uhoji Temple, there is a Basho Sentence Monument, a round stone monument, the handwriting has been blurred. There is a wooden sign next to the stele, which records the content of the stele: "In the second year of Genroku (1689), Matsuo Basho paid homage to the Ukiyo no Kita no Yamazakura Basho." I envy). Surrounding the Basho Sentence Monument are many echoing sentences from ;Niigata;;local; haiku celebrities at that time. Otohoji Temple has been a famous place for cherry blossom viewing since ancient times. Basho admired the beauty of the northern cherry blossoms here, even though it was not during the cherry blossom season when he visited. Looking at Sakura Leaves, he also expressed his envious mood in his imagination. Two of the echoing haiku of other haiku writers were singled out and written in the description of the stele. They were probably the most famous haiku poets in the area at that time. One of them is not jade, "Mitsukoshi Road や一の Temple の花ざかり", Mitsukoshi The road and Yi's Temple are filled with flowers. One song is by Yasuda Izabo, "Different gods and Buddhas". Different gods and Buddhas all have the beauty of cherry blossoms. They are all sentences praising cherry blossoms. In Japan, the word flower, if not specifically mentioned, is cherry blossom.

;

;In Niigata in early April, the cherry blossoms are in full bloom in previous years, but the spring of 2023 is coming fiercely, and when we arrived, the cherry blossoms were already a little overdue. In the garden of Otohoji Temple, on the round stone monument of Basho, there are several branches of cherry blossoms hanging down, on the eve of their withering. Behind the stele is a small hill, and on the steps are several red curtains from the temple, with the words "Namo Guanyin Bodhisattva" enshrined. The curtains fluttered gently in the sunshine and breeze. This sentiment and scene complement each other perfectly with the haikus tablet with unclear handwriting.

;

;Othoji Temple, like other Niigata landscapes, has very few tourists. I stood on the terrace outside the main hall, watching the yin and yang scene cut by the sun with the Buddha statues in the garden below. I have done this twice. Although the weather seems to be the same, there are obvious differences in the dividing lines between sunlight and shadow in early spring and early autumn.

;

;I visited Otohoji Temple again in September and suddenly discovered Kobo Daishi (Kukai) here. I didn’t notice it at all on that trip in April. There is a stone statue of Kobo Daishi Gozun here, which is a common standard shape of Kukai wearing a hat and leaning on a staff during his journey. This stone statue of Kukai is a bit cute, shaped into a pudgy little boy. I turned to the back of the base of the stone statue to read the description. The handwriting was a bit blurry, but I could clearly see the words "Pursuing the eighty-eight sacred sites of Shikoku...to commemorate..." and other words. It is estimated that someone went there before and erected a statue in Otohoji Temple after returning to Niigata. Benji was the monk Kukai's practice route. It later gradually became the most famous hiking route in the world, with a total length of more than 1,400 kilometers and 88 temples in Shikoku. Currently, more than half a million people from all over the world walk this road every year. This is also a strange fate for us. After seeing Kukai at Otohoji Temple, my friend Dr. Tan Weidong and I left Niigata the next day, flew to Osaka for a short stay, and then headed to Shikoku to start our plan Three years of preparation for the trip.
